param.name: input_data
param.label: Input table
param.help: Input file in a tabular/tsv/csv/parquet format

param.name: xlab
param.label: Label for the x axis

param.name: ylab
param.label: Label for the y axis

param.name: has_rownames
param.label: Does the first column of input table contain rownames?
param.help: Whether the first column of the input data table identifies the rownames (e.g. proteinID) - i.e. it is not a part of data matrix to be plotted.

param.name: transform_data
param.label: Should the quantitative variable be transformed?
param.help: Whether to transform the quantitative variable (e.g. intensity, counts, etc.)

param.name: use_grouping
param.label: Plot boxplot based on a column from the metadata table?
param.help: Whether to base the boxplot on a different variable than column names (usually corresponding to the samples) from the input table.

param.name: input_metadata
param.label: Input metadata table
param.help: Input metadata file in a tabular format

param.name: sampleID
param.label: Sample identification column in metadata table
param.help: Column containing sample names - it should correspond to the colNames in the data table.

param.name: groupingCol
param.label: Which variable column to plot on the x-axis?
param.help: Which column from the metadata table should be plotted on x axis?

param.name: colorCol
param.label: Color the boxplot based on a variable?
param.help: Which column from the metadata table should be used for coloring?

param.name: facet_x
param.label: Column to use as facet on x-axis
param.help: If using faceting, which column should be plotted on x-axis? Default 'Nothing selected' means no faceting will be done on x-axis.

param.name: facet_y
param.label: Column to use as facet on y-axis
param.help: If using faceting, which column should be plotted on y-axis? Default 'Nothing selected' means no faceting will be done on y-axis.

param.name: sort_by
param.label: Sort the bars based on frequency, degree or both?
param.help: Whether to sort the bars in UpSet plot based on frequency (largest frequency first), or degree (largest overlap first)

param.label: Number of intersections to plot
param.name: nintersects
param.help: Number of intersections to plot. If value set to 0, all intersections will be plotted.

param.name: group_by_sets
param.label: Group bars by sets?
param.help: Whether group bars for each set (based on their set size).

param.name: empty_intersections
param.label: Include empty intersections?
param.help: Whether to plot also empty intersections to the limit of number of intersections. Otherwise, empty intersections are by default omitted.

param.name: input_data
param.label: Input table in a long format
param.help: Input file in a tabular/tsv/csv/parquet format

param.name: quant_col
param.label: Which column contains the quantitative information?
param.help: Select the column containing quantitative information.

param.name: grouping_col
param.label: Which column contains the categories?
param.help: Select the column which contains the categories.

param.name: color_col
param.label: Which column to color according to?
param.help: Select the column which contains levels for color.

param.name: position
param.label: Use position dodge?
param.help: If a column for color is specified, should be the categories placed side-by-side or stacked (default)?

param.name: export_R_script
param.label: Export the R script to reproduce the analysis
param.help: Check this box to export the script executed in the Galaxy tool as an R file to be able to reproduce the same processing offline. Not that in this case, the file paths need to be altered and all the dependencies have to be managed manually.
